text:
Hi there, is there a straight forward way to slice / create views of a multi-dimensional array based on a presence of a specific value within an indice?
e.g. using this false as kind of a delimiter in order to chunk the array for further processing
```true 3 4 5
true 4 4 1
false
true 1 2 1
true 1 1 1```

elements.text:
Hi there, is there a straight forward way to slice / create views of a multi-dimensional array based on a presence of a specific value within an indice?
e.g. using this false as kind of a delimiter in order to chunk the array for further processing

text:
think I found the solution.
`hcat(cumsum(raw_data[:,1] .== ""), raw_data)` to create a rank
then `[x for x in groupby(x -> x[1], eachrow(raw_data))]` to aggregate

elements.text: [x for x in groupby(x -> x[1], eachrow(raw_data))]
